Didn't take long for me to get my poutine and go.  By this time,  everyone that was waiting to be seated was at a table,  probably because most of the diners were finishing up their meals and leaving.  As I was leaving,  there were still lots of people walking in.  The place is open 24/7, which is awesome for those late night grease fixes. I picked at some of the fries while it was still warm.  Fries were crispy, which is a must when drenched in La Banquise's thick, flavorful gravy.  And the curds! Deliciously squeaky! They do not cheap out on the curds and it was all melted by the gravy. (unmelted curds are my pet peeve) I wish I had this fresh in the restaurant,  as I feel like getting it as take out took away from the experience,  ...and the wind chill cooled my poutine off pretty quick that I'm sure it was way better hot.  I'd come back again to try this out the right way. Cash (US or CAD) or debit only.  They don't accept old 50 dollar bills either.  Free wifi available. About 10 min walk from metro station. (Mont Royal stop)

Visiting Montreal, I could not resist the urge to at least taste some of the world-renown poutine that the city has to offer.After extensive Yelping, I decided on La Banquise for lunch. The poutine itself was very rich as it was drenched in gravy and loaded with sausage, bacon, mushrooms, and of course... CHEESE CURDS. Although it was a little salty for my preferences, I enjoyed the meal. The fries were perfect and the bacon added a beautiful crunch. A must try!

I have heard some many nice reviews about the Banquise, that I had to try their poutine.I ordered the classic Poutine and I realized (this is my second time having true Quebecois classic poutine) that I am not a big fan of the dish itself, even if it's made by the best poutine place in town.I found the gravy very heavy and very salty.   The fries, because they are smothered in gravy are not crispy.  The cheese curds are nice and chewy, like they are supposed to be.  Overall an OK experience, but I think for me, the gourmet fries are the way to go, where you can pick a topping that does not drench the crispy fries with sauce and you can regulate what type of salty add-on you want on your crispy fries. Open 24 hours !

This is probably one of the best spots for poutine in Montreal, specially for tourists. It'd be a place selling its popularity haha.But we can't deny that the food is great, generous portion lol, great sauce and the toppings for poutine dishes are quite various. They also have other dishes like burgers, chips, etc. I went to La Banquise 3 times and I was never disappointed. I'll recommend these poutine dishes with smoked meat and some kinds of meat. Really a good choice.A bonus point for La Banquise might be its cozy atmosphere during the winter, open 24/7.And obviously, there will be a long waiting line. Anyway, enjoy your meal! It's a must in Montreal.

Coming from the US, poutine was at the top of our must-consume list!La Banquise did not disappoint. It was especially delicious after having a couple of drinks, hah. Came around 1:30am which our Uber driver said was the perfect time v. 3am when all the bars let out. We had the La Maim & La Panoramix. Personally, my bf & I liked the La Maim better. The sausage used paired nicely in the combination. We each ordered regular size, ate all of the La Maim since we wanted this most fresh, took home leftovers of the Panoramix, and 100% ate that the next night. One criticism is it was a tad too greasy and lost a bit of the fries taste, but it was too good I didn't mind it as much.Loved the spacious seating! Be sure to bring cash in the local currency & be prepared to pay ahead of receiving your meal.

Worth the wait in line, outside, in the rain! The tables are close together and the noise level is high but it all plays into the Banquise atmosphere with stellar music as well. The poutine is hands down the best. My hubby had the smoked meat poutine and it was a fresh slice of heaven. I had La Matty which had peppers, onions, mushrooms, and bacon and there was a different flavor xombo with each bite...delish! We opted for the regular and I struggled to finish.  Definitely worth a visit!!

Food: 4/5Service: 4/5Cleanliness: 4/5Decor & Style: 3/5The menu here is huge. There is probably more different types of poutine here than the rest of North America combined. I got the pepperoni/sausage poutine and it was pretty good, nothing that made me say "wow" though. The Montreal stout here was great!When I visit Montreal in the future I will still probably find other poutine places to compare instead of coming back here though.Overall a definite must for a first timer in Montreal!Oh yeah, a very odd thing here...each time you purchase a beer, or another food item on the menu, you have to pay immediately (yes this is a full sit-down service restaurant). So every time I ask the server for another beer, I have to pay with cash or with a Canadian debit card immediately! I've never seen this anywhere else in the world i've traveled to!No American debit/credit cards accepted and no Canadian credit cards accepted. Only Canadian Cash or Canadian Debit cards accepted.

I confess I was a poutine virgin until my Classique arrived. I've lived in poutine country (upstate New York) for 10 years now but didn't see how this fat-on-fat extravaganza could do anything but clog your arteries. But the Classique opened my eyes as well. The salty beef (?) gravy, firm cheese curds and excellent fries were in perfect harmony, much like lettuce, tomato and onion on a nice greasy burger.By way of comparison my teen, a fries fanatic, ordered the Savoyard with bacon and onions and couldn't finish it. Moral of this story: order the Classique.

First stop in Montreal - definitely eat a poutine! The wait wasn't that long for a table when I arrived around 11am, but it got a bit busy after awhile. I know there are limited on street parking.La Banquise have 30 different poutine to choose from and an additional vegan cheese and sauce! Their poutine ranges $7.95 to $19.65 depending on the size and which toppings you get. A regular size honestly fills you up - there were 9 of us and all of us can't even finish a regular size. If you get a poutine with meat on it, they load it up with a lot! I got the La Taquise and it wasn't as heavy as the other ones as it has guacamole, sour cream and tomatoes. Honestly, it could be better as the cheese curds weren't melted even thought I mixed it with the gravy. If I were to come back, I'll definitely share with someone.

Nice that it is open 24/7. Be warned to bring CASH either CAD or USD. There is a wait. Service is pretty fast. I  got the Pogo poutine. Personally, not a huge fan of soggy fries, but it is a good place if you like poutine.
Poutine was sooo good. Many options/combinations. A small beer selection available. Friendly wait staff. Clean bathrooms. Cash or Canadian debit only.

TL;DR: La Banquise is the place to go for poutine in Montreal. The options range from the classic to ones with a fusion of flavours from different cultures.VERDICT: I recommend but expect to wait in line.My friends and I ordered the Rachel, the Reggae, and the La Savoyarde. All are delicious. The Reggae was my favourite as it had a lot of freshness from the avocado and tomatoes. As a result, it did not feel as heavy as the others. The Rachel was more savoury to me than the La Savoyarde. The onions are grilled very well with a delicious caramelised flavour.The service is quick and efficient. We arrived right around dinner time and only waited 10 minutes to be seated. Our server was very friendly and attentive. Casual vibe filled with locals and tourists at any given time of the day.

You can't go wrong with a poutine from la banquise. It's the classic place if you wanna try a good, juicy poutine full of flavour. They have over 20 different kinds of poutine with different toppings. So you will for sure find your favourite topping! Its open 24H. Their regular size is huge. The place is always packed at night. But their poutine is worth the wait!
The place is really cozy, very colorful for decorations. They have big portion for the food! So delicious! Good for late night munchies and they open late hours too so very nice!

This place is definitely a must visit if you love eating poutine.  It opens 24/7 and is always busy with a line outside.  This was my second time eating here.  I arrived at 5 pm on a weekday and there were 3 people in front of me. It didn't take long before I was seated and looking over their menu.  They have quite a few combinations and toppings to select from.  I finally decided to get a regular sized La Fred Caillou which comes with ground beef, smoked meat, spicy sausage and merguez sausage.  A meat lovers paradise for sure!  My plate arrived at the table in about 3 minutes and it was piled high like a mountain. The gravy was amazing and all the toppings were tasty.  I recommend ordering the regular size if you are by yourself as they are quite generous with their portions.  By the time I left the restaurant, there were about 20 people waiting in line outside. If you are visiting Montreal, make sure you drop by this place.  You won't be disappointed.

My wife and I travel from NH every year to Montreal and this is a must stop. Food is great, the staff is very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend many different options of poutine and other delicious burgers / sides. The price ranges between 12-18 depending on the size.
A big serving of poutine. Pair it with beer and you're solved! A bit crowded knowing their small space but it's definitely worth it!
Beat poutine in my entier life, I recommend the Royal one in regular size along with "le bec cranberry" which is an amazing drink !
Best poutine ever!! The line was long so be prepared to wait. If you're doing takeout, I believe there shouldn't be a long line for that.

One of the main reasons I came to Montreal is for the poutine. Amazing reviews and a must try out place. They are open 24/7. The poutine is best when you are drunk or a bit intoxicated. But you can have it anytime as well. A lot of options to choose from.  A definite must try out place.If you are from the US, they do not accept US cards. They accept USD or just try to have Canadian dollars.

Came by here Saturday night around 12am (opened 24 hr which is awesome) and it wasn't that busy! After we got seated and ordered I noticed there was a fast wave of people coming here. There's a lottttaaa stuff on the menu and you might get overwhelmed so check up yelp for pics for reference. The waitress we had was very attentive and checked up on us every so often and filling our water. After 11pm I think is when they tell you to pay after you order - makes sense. They have no problems splitting the bill as well. I ordered the regular bougaloo which is the pulled pork poutine with coleslaw and a huge slab of sour cream on top of it. This place has huge portions. I couldn't finish my poutine! I wasn't a fan of the sour cream, only had a bit. It was too heavy for my liking. The coleslaw I didn't like at first, but after mixing it with the sauce, I think it tasted better so that combo was good. The pulled pork was good and had a lot of flavour. Fries.. not bad. I've had better fries at other places but it was still good. As for drinks, I got a ginger beer (non alcoholic) and it very refreshing with the poutine. Fair warning: it is more on the spicier ginger side.  Overall, good food and service. I'm glad I finally got to try the famous poutine place in Montreal! Will come back to try other poutines and I love how it's opened 24 hr!

This place was ok, I thought it would be tastier but it was just ok. I would only go there for the poutine and nothing else. Had the smoke meat sandwich it was bland but tasted good.The smokes meat poutine was also good but was just salty could have tasted better. The crispy chicken poutine was actually pretty bad. It seems that they use frozen chicken patties and not very tasty. See the pictures.

Great Poutine Every. Single. Time. Best part is that it's open 24/7. We love coming here and trying different kinds of Poutine!! Our experience has always been good. Service is excellent and the servers are super friendly. Lineup is usually long but moves fast! Only thing that i dislike about the place is that it's not very clean. The floors and tables are usually wet or dirty, and we have to request for a different table or spot each time. Apart from this, this place is great!

We were visiting from NYC, and had to come to this place because everyone raved about it. We came in around 5 on Sunday for dinner and it was packed. When we were leaving the line was SO long! The poutine was really good. We got the one with sausage, bacon, and mushrooms and added guacamole to it. (Large size) was good for 2 people, except there was a bit too much guac. The gravy was great and our cheese curds melted too and were really stringy! We also got a burger to share "all-dressed". We didn't realize that meant it came with mustard (instead of ketchup) so we didn't really enjoy it.The service was ok, no one really came to refill our waters but the food made up for it. Also, they don't accept American debit cards or cash so you basically are forced to use the ATM machine and pay a fee.

If you're looking for a lot of options... there are a lot of options for poutine at this place. Went out of out way to try this place and in my opinion- the poutine was not as amazing as I had expected. The poutine was good and filling. It was tasty.

Their poutines are perfectly good for a poutine, yes. But for the life of me, I just don't understand the complete obsession with this place or poutines in general, so perhaps I'm not even the best candidate to write a review for this. Yes, everybody loves poutine at 3am when drunk, and on a winter hangover day, or sporadically maybe a few times a year. They are particularly good at Banquise, so I will grade simply for that (good to me basically only means how squeaky and fresh the cheese remains on top - otherwise I've never really tasted a deviation from standard poutine taste.)But really, it's only worthwhile to come here and get a poutine when drunk, as a novelty to show out of towners, or on the rare occasion when you just really need one. If I wanted a burger, I'd go many other places. It's not a spot I return to very often, not only because it's always extremely busy and a long line on many days when honestly, a poutine is a poutine and many places in Montreal make theirs just as good as Banquise.

This is THE spot to try Poutine in Montreal! We were lucky to go during a snowy day, around 2pm and there was no line at all to get in. Be aware that you need to pay either with cash, debit card or canadian credit card - but not with an international credit card (bummer). Service is quick and friendly. The list of Poutine options is almost overwhelming haha, you have so many combinations available ! You can choose between the regular and large size. I decided to try the B.O.M (regular size), including the fries, the brown sauce, caramelized oignon, merguez sausage and bacon. And drink a ginger beer, the combination was perfect. I wasn't hungry until very late at night. Great spot!
They don't accept American cards, get your cash ready or you can withdrawal from the front door ATM machine. The food alone deserves 5 stars. I love this place!!!

Y'all the large was huge but made for a perfect late night snack. Poutine is SO GOOD and imo the classic is the way to go. So simple yet so delicious. Wasn't a fan of the sausage on the TRex but bacon and ground beef was fire. The line was out the door when I got here, but it goes by pretty fast. Canadian debit or cash only! The staff is so friendly this place rocks and is worth the wait!

What more needs to be said. I got the smoked meat poutine, she got the breaded chicken poutine. We both ordered the grande portion, which is absurdly huge. We were able to finish it because we had not eaten in like 8 hours but be warned it is a massive portion, suitable for 2 people, and it does not do the poutine justice to eat that much due to palate fatigue of the richness, the salt etc. Delicious food, worth the wait as the line moves quickly. If you are visiting Montreal you MUST GO HERE.THEY DO NOT ACCEPT AMERICAN CARDS HERE. Be warned, get cash out of their ATM in the front of the restaurant which was very inexpensive, I think it charged $2 for a withdrawal.

The location of the restaurant was too far from the Metro station but it was worth taking a long walk. I arrived at the place around 6:00p.m. on a weekday and could take a seat right away.Ordered La trois viandes & L'Écossaise beer and they were wonderful!French fries were fresh and cheese cud was nicely mixed with other ingredients. The amount was super a lot although I had a smaller dish.Servers were friendly and kind. Meal was served pretty quickly.It was little bit crowded and noisy because people keep coming after 6:00p.m. If you want quiet place, La Banquise will not be suitable.

My friend told me that if I go to Montreal, I MUST go to La Banquise and honestly, I was underwhelmed. The food was just okay and they were lacking in the gravy department. Perhaps I need to go back and try it again but for now, I found poutine at random bars to be better.

Though I don't have much experience with poutines and can only see myself eating this heart-clogging concoction maybe once a year, if you're in the area, I definitely think that this place is worth a visit.  Poutines come in two sizes: regular and large. But the regular portion is probably enough to feed two. They do not skimp on their ingredients - the portions are massive! I got La Reggae, which came with ground beef, guacamole, diced tomatoes & hot peppers, all atop crispy fries and covered with cheese curds and gravy. I brought leftovers home, and surprisingly they were still very good heated up the next day!

It's very interesting to see that a cuisine has developed from French fries and this place proves it. Lots of Yelp reviews and lots of people who love this place.  The line was out the door and they are open 24 hours.  Just discovering the menu was impressive.  What else can we do while waiting in line?  Parking in the other hand was so difficult.  The police station is right in front of the restaurant so if you do happen to find a spot in the area, make sure you read all the signs to make sure it's a valid parking spot.The place was packed and it was close to an hour before we finally got inside.  Seating is very close to each other.  It's pretty loud inside but because of tables are separated by mere inches, I found myself eavesdropping on the couple seated next to us discussing what to order.  Servers were super busy but still managed to get the orders right unlike some other places.  We tried the BOM with ginger beer.  The combo made quite a pair!  I can only imagine what it would taste like with beer.  I was also pleasantly surprised by the gravy.  The dish itself wasn't as salty as I was expecting it to be, which is great because that meant I could actually finish eating g everything!  Not sure if I like poutine but it was a good first-time experience for me.  Thanks, La Banquiste!

My friends and I came here for some poutine, and we got the Elvis! It had ground beef, bell pepper, and mushrooms on top of the usual fries, cheese curds, and gravy. The flavor of everything was delicious, although there weren't enough cheese curds for my taste. Portions were also quite big, and we really enjoyed it! At around 12 CAD post-tax, the price point is quite on point for the amount of food and quality. Service was a tad lacking, and there was stuff floating in our water. Otherwise, I have no complaints and I would recommend it!

Long wait and a very tight squeeze in the restaurant (we had to share a long table like booth and were placed on the outside- which meant when anyone from the table of 4 next to us needed to use the restroom, we had to get up) but the food was good! I'm not sure if it's the best poutine in the world but it definitely satisfied our craving for it. Would come back again.

My boyfriend and I went here around 2:30PM on a Saturday. We knew we were at the right location because the line was out the door! However, the line didn't last more than 45 minutes, which was definitely worth it. We both got regular-sized orders of La Classique poutine. If you want to feel less greasy, I recommend ordering one to share (if there's just two people).I expected the cheese curds to have more flavor, but overall it was as yummy as everyone says it is! The restaurant is very cramped and everyone sits close together, but it makes for a fun experience.
Um these were just okay. Not the biggest fan of  poutine I guess. Seems like over hyped disco fries to be honest.
Yes we were poutine virgins. But we are no more! A great casual place to eat poutine. We had La Maddy with bacon and La Obelisk with smoked meat. Poor were great and plenty for 3 people.

Montreal is known for poutine, so I had to get it. I found this place on Yelp and the reviews looked great so decided to try it. My family and I were seat on their outside patio, and honestly that day we went it was hot and super sunny. The patio coverings on top wasn't enough and the sun kept on shinning in my face. It wasn't that enjoyable to be honest. The sun even made the table hot so I could rest my arms on the table. Anyways, as for the poutine, I ordered the La Elvis and the royal. The Elvis one was pretty good. I really liked the ground beef with the mushrooms and bell peppers. As for the royal poutine... SAUCE, SAUCE AND MORE SAUCE! It was just smothered in sauce. In my opinion, the sauce made it not taste as great. Overall, it was OK eating poutine here, but I would try other places as well.
Poutines were great!! This was our first time having a poutine and they were great. I don't normally even eat potatoes but these were definitely worth it!

Well, poutine sounds like a big deal at Montreal, I had to get it at least once. So we were in this place waiting on a long line for 40 minutes to get inside at about 10 pm. The poutine with smocked meat was pretty good, specially in a cold night, comforting my stomach. On the other hand, I am on diet, this plate of poutine looks like 2000+ calories, I feel very guilty about having it. Oh well, my heart is always filled with hopeless and unnecessary resistance when  I sit in front of tempting food. Regardless, I am only human.

Meilleure Poutine au Monde Entier!!!!!I love La Banquise SO much! Yes, sometimes you will need to wait up to an hour to get a table but it is SO worth it. My personal favourite is the simple bacon poutine... But I've tried many others that are equally good. Now that I live in Florida, I miss La Banquise so much and wish that they could deliver to Tallahassee!

Dined in on a rainy Sunday evening and sat down right away, which I was surprised after hearing about how long the lines can get just to get in. Well boy am I glad we hiked through Mount Royal park to get here, it was well worth the exercise. I ordered the bacon, onions, Swiss cheese and sour cream poutine and substituted the cheese curds for mozzarella cheese, boy was it delicious!!! Highly recommend traveling to this part of town to try their poutine, they have like 37 different kinds!!!

Famous poutine spot to try after a drinking night out in Montréal. Poutines are over the top and messy with many ingredients, but still very delicious. Unless you are sharing with someone, get a regular. If you want to share, then the large sizes are perfect for you.The Sud-Ouest poutine was intense. Poutine was topped with bacon, red onions, guac, chipotle sauce, annnd onion rings! I felt like I was inhaling grease as I was eating it. It could have used a bit more bacon, but then again, any dish could use more bacon. Place is cash-only so come with some change. There's an ATM machine inside if you don't mind the fees. Restaurant is also a tourist-trap so it gets filled quickly and you may need to wait in line if you come during a busy hour. Seating is available for large crowds!

I had no idea what I was getting myself into when we came here but why in the world do Americans not have poutine?!?! I had the Mexican one & it's was tasty, spicy, creamy, and cheesy! Everything it should have been! Reasonably fast service and insanely busy so you know it's good food! Enjoyed my experience and I need them to open near my hometown, not in it cause I would be there too often!

We visited Montreal again and we made a point to stop at the Banquise also. My wife and daughter loves this place! It was a challenge to get there this time. We arrived in Montreal in the middle of the lunch rush hour on a Friday afternoon and found it difficult to get to the Banquise because of construction and road closures. Rue Rachel is currently closed in front of the Banquise right at the moment (Mid August 2018). So we decided to try the next day on our way out and found it easier during the Saturday morning traffic to get there and find parking. Thankfully, La Banquise is 24 hours. My wife ordered the La Matty dejeurner with 2 sunny side up eggs, sautéed onions, mushrooms and green peppers along with the poutine. This dish was flavourful with the sautéed vegetables and eggs taking away the saltiness of the poutine. I ordered the Clasique to go while my daughter ordered La Bacon. Still recommended to come and visit when in Montreal. #66 of 2018

The line was out the door even on a Monday, but it went quickly and was worth the wait.We ordered a large Shoot Out poutine with smoked meat, bacon, sausage, cheese curds, and gravy for $18.  The portion size was huge for two (yay, leftovers!) and more importantly, delicious.  All the meat!!!!  Nice beer selection as well, mostly under $6 bottle.Positive service, chefs singing along to Bohemian Rhapsody, and great vibe overall.I highly recommend it and hope to get back again.

Oh Poutine! The variety!We had a crazy night after a bachelor party and this place definitely comforting. Tasty carbs! The place was full and we didn't had reservation but was still seated well! Service was prompt and they were really friendly! Would recommend!

I had the classic poutine with onions and sour cream on the side together with a Banquise burger. It was ok. The cheese on top of the poutine was not melted which would have elevated this dish. The fries themselves however did exceed my expectations as they were fresh and crisp. I was worried the fries would be limp and soggy which I am pleased to report they are not. I wanted to stick to the classic poutine to get a real feel for this authentic dish however I noticed most of the other diners had their poutine all "gussied up" with a ton of toppings and may have not really tasted the gravy and cheese.The Banquesi Burger was just ok. Nothing special and next time I would skip the burger. Service was great and the place was kitschy and worth a visit.

La Banquise is the most popular poutine place according to my girlfriend. I was super excited to check it out and even skipped dinner, hoping to fully maximize enjoyment. Seeing the line out the door confirmed its popularity. It was packed at 10 pm, even before the bar crowd got there.La Banquise definitely has the biggest menu of poutine i've ever seen. There are 20+ different options and includes many toppings that you would not normally think about putting on poutine (ie. guacamole, smoked meat, coleslaw). For the poutine-phobic, there are burgers and breakfast items as well.I ordered "La Rachel" which included green peppers, mushrooms and onions. While all the ingredients worked well with each other, I found it bland and underseasoned. Maybe it was my fault for not ordering a meat topping, but I thought the gravy could be more flavorful.  Good poutine, but definitely not the best i've ever had. I probably should have opted for the classic, or picked one with a flavorful protein topping. Pricing was good and portions were large. I found it weird that you had to pay up front before receiving the food. Maybe too much dine and dashing?  Anyways, I was a bit disappointed but I think it's still worth checking out to get your poutine fix.

I don't know what else can be written about La Banquise then what's already been said. When in Montreal, you must try Poutine. What is it? In the simplest terms, it's french fries topped with gravy and cheese curds. It might sound weird and repulsive but there's something magical about crunchy, salty, and gooey goodness. Where can you find Poutine? Well, almost every restaurant sells it. However, like burgers, some restaurants do a great job at it while some are terrible. La Banquise, for me, was the best Poutine that I tried out of 5 other places.Here are my ratings based on different criteria:Quality of food: Excellent. There is just about every combination and topping that you can get on your Poutine. When I asked my waiter for his favorite, he unquestionably said La Reggae. Since he had been working there for years and sounded like he knew what he was talking about, that's the one that I went with. La Raggae comes with: ground beef, guacamole, tomatoes, and hot peppers. The guacamole was super fresh and the hot peppers really were hot. The fries were freshly fried and had just the right amount of beef on them. My Poutine was delicious!Decor: okay. With a place that is so popular for Poutine, I was expecting more history on either the restaurant or the products it sells. Sadly, there was nothing that special inside to see. There's also an area to sit outside on asphalt but you can't have beer there.Cleanliness: good. The staff did a good job keeping the place neat and tidy.Service: okay. My cup of water was filled only once and the waiter didn't ask how my food was or if I needed anything else. He did bring me the check really fast when asked.Speed of food preparation: slow. Although this is a very busy restaurant, the 3-4 ingredients that it takes to make Poutine should not take a 30 min wait.Price: a wee bit on the higher side. My Poutine was around $12 USD which was a little bit on the higher end.If you're ready to wait in line and have a so-so service experience, this is probably the best tasting Poutine place in Montreal.

no US credit cards as payment, so bring cash or have a Canadian debit cardSuper casual poutine place that was recommended by many people. I've got no issues with it. I'm just not an overall fan of poutine as a main course. It's filling (but not satisfying as a full meal) and the service is good. My friend and I share a small classic poutine. They have a lot more menu options for the more adventurous though!!! They also have cheeseburgers and hotdogs, which we didn't try.The gravy was warm and the fries were substantial. Does poutine's gravy usually melt the cheese curds? Seems like it doesn't, but if I made the rules, I think it should. We went on a very snowy day and were seated immediately.

Had to try the Classique Poutine for our first time ever in Montreal! It was delicious. The gravy wasn't as thick as we thought, which was great because we shared a large plate and we didn't feel gross & stuffed.  The cheese curds were nice & chunky.  We also ordered the La banquise burger and it was good too. It was very juicy. They have a whole page of different kinds of poutine. Some with meat and others with vegetables. You are sure to find something you like!

La Banquise is wonderful. The service is very friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere is very cozy. I've only been there once and tried the classic poutine. I'd love to try their other varieties as well in the future. You can never go wrong with the classic. It's hot, crispy, savory, delicious, and comforting during a cold winter day. It's one of the best meals you could have in Montreal, and I look forward to coming back some day.

This is probably one of my favourite places to have a poutine, the iconic food in Montreal. Everything was so perfect from the food to the customer service. As this is a pretty popular restaurant in Montreal, the wait times can be long.

I absolutely hate to tell the truth sometimes  (and only highlight great places try)  BUT  La Banquise can handle it since there's too many great reviews... For being the place to go for poutine I thought it's  pretty awful .POUTINE was  Bad and just not edible. I concurred that poutine is probably NOT my thing (which it's still kinda NOT) until I had another....I would say If interesting in trying GREAT poutine go to POUNTINEVILLE (the poutine with smoked meat is actually so so delicious-try it!! A Montreal 2-in-1)

I went to La Banquise on a Tuesday at noon for lunch and didn't have to wait to be seated, thankfully! This was the last place I ate at before leaving Montreal, and I'm so glad I got to try it. My friend and I ordered the fried pickles, la savoyarde poutine, and la banquise burger. The burger was okay, but the fried pickles and poutine were amazing! I was a bit skeptical about the poutine at first because it looked like it was doing too much, but now after I've tried it, I regret not having ordered the larger portion. Try the fried pickles and la savoyarde poutine (bacon, onions, swiss cheese, and sour cream). You won't regret it! This place only accepts USD (they'll do the conversion for you), CAD, and Canadian debit cards.

I used to find La Banquise flat out gross with greasy floppy fries, hard cheese and everything was just in a goop.Went back last weekend, it wasn't as bad as it used to be. The cheese still doesn't melt but the fries are quite good now.I'd come back after drinking but sober I'd go somewhere else

Okay so poutine is a staple of my diet since its basically a carb coma in a bowl with some awesome little invention called cheese curds that make everything you hate in the world fade away into obscurity for 25 minutes until you finish your little bowl of heaven and then go back to the mundane shitshow we have to call "life". I must mention we have a dude who is deathly allergic to wheat with us and we called in advance to see that it is gluten free here and the person on the phone said "yep" so we came here, otherwise we wouldnt have bothered with the enslaught of drunk asshats and short staff buffoonery that enaued.So my girlfriend took me and a group here (like 12 people) and the staff immediately threw a hissy fit about the size of our group, forcing us to sit at two opposite ends of the establishment - 6 at one table, 6 at another. Like we had no problem waiting for two adjacent tables, but it was their rush to get our money that split the group. We ordered. Literally just poutine. Just mess me up with potatoes, gravy and cheese, but then they tell my friend that the sauce is gluten free but the rest of the restaurant isn't because they use the same fryer for everything. So why did they advertise and confirm on the phone they are a gluten free place? To get a quick buck or to basically annoy me, I'm not so sure.Our poutine arrives and its adequate at best. Basically you can get better poutine at Le Belle Pro, but this is a sit down place so they upcharge you. Oh and my friend found a kitchen screw in her poutine. How, idk, but they have a saying in Hawai'i which is "broke da mouf" meaning its good, and I think this place took it literal instead of figuratively or the place is just falling apart period.Moral of the story is this place is an expensive joke and best left in a corner or shared with people you hate from out of country.  Way to ruin poutine, guys.

Fitting that this was our first stop in Montréal.Atmosphere: Huge! We came on a Friday night around 9pm, and the line was well out the door, however the line for eat in moves rather fast. We waited about 20 minutes before we were seated. It has a college-vibe - loud and young.Food: Ordered the regular classic and la fred caillou. Regular classic is fries, cheese curds, and gravy. The Fred Caillou was gravy, fries, cheese curds, ground beef, two types of sausages, and smoked meat. The fries here are OUTSTANDING. Crispy and flavorful, I would get them alone next time. The classic was good, although the cheese curds were a bit more rubbery than what I'm accustomed to. The gravy is smooth an adds a good touch to the fries. The Fred Caillou is a meat lover's dream, however it is incredibly heavy. I enjoyed the spicy sausage though. They also have a nice variety of sodas and beers (I love you, lemoncocco)Services: Canadian dollars or debit only. ATM in the front before you get seated. Service is friendly and quick and they make you pay first if you're eating after 9.

Nothing like a 24 poutine place to satisfy your poutine cravings at allll times. Came here at 7.30am in the morning for breakfast. Tried the breakfast poutine: "la cassoulette" loaded with sweet sweet bacon (plus sausages) and 2 eggs that screams a typical hearty breakfast, but poutine style. It met all my expectations. The potatoes were the bite size, smothered in a rich savoury gravy! Cheese curds were good but ordering an extra serving appears it be quite costly. Decor and ambiance was funky and cozy, loved it!!! Service was fast and pleasant. Never thought I'd say this, but poutine at 7.30am in the morning at la banquise was a surprisingly great way to start my morning. Heads up, portions are big (perhaps I'm not used to eating just fries as meals)!! Pack up the leftovers and hike up mount royal, you'll be able to stomach it then!

Was told this was THE place to get poutine. Arrived around 9pm and waited ~20 minutes for a seat. The place was packed and folks lined up a ways. Ordered the chicken poutine and husband got one with bacon, sour cream, etc. Kid opted for spaghetti. The portion was big, and it tasted nice, but not sure where this place got such a great reputation. I wouldn't have a desire to go back. Maybe I got the wrong kind?

This was our favorite poutinerie in Montréal! There was an entire page devoted to different types of toppings. We had Le Miam, which was topped with an assortment of sausage and smoked meat. The gravy felt just right; not too heavy nor light. The fries were well-seasoned but not overly salty, and had a nice crispness. The poutine portion was great; the regular would be a very hearty meal for one, and the large could easily fill up 2-3 alone. We also had the Chevre and the Montréal burgers; the former had a wonderfully creamy goat cheese that was delicious with the burger, while the latter was a great representation of Montréal's smoked meat. The burgers themselves were on the smaller side, but not to a fault; when combined with the regular poutine, it was just the right amount of food for us two. The place in general had a nice ambience and the waiter was very friendly, although he did awkwardly stand by our table with the bill while we pulled out our cash to pay. I would definitely come here again, especially knowing that it is open 24 hours. Be prepared to wait in line if you come during the dinner rush though!--Rating Rubric--5* - As good as it gets; goes above and beyond. I would come here again and again!4* - Worth checking out; a good value. No major complaints or only minor flaws that set this place back. I'm glad I tried it, but I might not come back here in lieu of trying somewhere new.3* - A few setbacks that soured the experience. Not the worst, but I wouldn't recommend it to friends.2* - Multiple setbacks that made me dislike the place.1* - I was personally offended by the people or services. Steer clear!

I was told that this place is a Montreal must, and I can see why.  My fiancé and I showed up around midnight on a Saturday night, and it was HOPPING!  We waited in line for maybe five minutes and ended up on their enclosed patio, which was fine, although I'm pretty sure they mentioned that they don't serve alcohol out there.  We ordered two poutines, and they were giant and tasty.  The service was efficient and good, and I actually liked that you had to pay before your food came, because we didn't have to track down our waitress when we were ready to leave.  Definitely add this place to your list if you're visiting Montreal!

Cash and Canadian debit card restaurant but they do have an ATM by the entrance. It is highly rated on yelp so it was a must try on my end while touring Montréal. Overall it felt like it was a typical diner. Wasn't the cleanest. Didn't have the best service. Waitress forgot my coke (which is canned just FYI) and when I reminded her, I was actually charged for it (was suppose to come with my meal) but didn't know until after I already paid. I got the fully dressed hot dog which I wish they listed what fullydressed was on the menu but maybe I just missed it. The hot dog was good. Nothing spectacular. We went by the recommendation of the waitress for our poutine but I wish we stuck with a classic. I don't prefer guac on my poutine. It was really hot. My water was served with limited ice and refilled without ice. The poutine options were great, so many but with the diner feel and the push people in, push people out "feel", it's not something that hits home for me.
It's a long wait, but worth it. The regular size poutine is plenty. Friendly staff and great music too!

This is thee cutest place to have Poutine with a fun, hipster atmosphere. Apparently, word has caught on since there can be a long lineup that spills outside, but the Staff is efficient and keeps the line moving. Two things to remember when you line up: there is an ATM right inside at the corner of the hall (immediately to your right through the front door). Convenient! The other, is that it's a very narrow space where you line up with no sitting room. When my aunt and I got to the front of the line, we were given the option of inside or outside. You can consume alcohol inside but not out, so since were weren't, we opted for outside patio since it was sunset on the longest day of the year with a nice breeze! Our waitress spoke broken English but my aunt spoke broken French so we got along just fine! I wish I knew the waitress' name, but she was also quite helpful in directing us to the nearest Metro station as we were purely on foot. To the food: amazing!!! The menu is in both languages (yay) & I opted for the "Trio" of a delicious chicken burger (the veggie option was out of stock) and paid about $4 extra for authentic Poutine instead of regular French fries which I had been meaning to try all week. The combo included a soda as well and wow! My aunt and I were BLOWN AWAY and went to foodie heaven! The Poutine was perfectly gooey and the chicken burger had this amazing special sauce that had a sweet, mustardy taste to it that I've never had before. My only regret is that I live too far away to go back on a regular basis! One last thought is how aesthetically pleasing the outdoor patio is. Strung lights across the top perimeter and cozy tables in a garden setting is perfect, particularly in warmer weather. The interior definitely had a rock n roll bar/pub type atmosphere and everyone has having a great time. A must-go if you're ever in Montreal. I know when I'm in town, I'm going straight to La Banquise!

the whole internet was about their poutine. It was just OK! nice staff, very helpful, food will be ready pretty fast, however, there's nothing special about these poutines to worth the long line.they're very popular among tourists because it's everywhere on the internet as the best poutine place in Montreal.we ordered the one with onion, and bacon, and the one with sausages and smoked meat. both well prepared and portions are huge. one regular is good for 2 I think.the atmosphere is like any other touristy restaurant, and you sit very closely to other customer and every body's in rush to get you in and out as fast as possible.if you're in Montreal for the first time you may want to go there. it's like any other touristic place all around the world. you should go there to take the picture ;)
Awesome food.  Great atmosphere.   The crowd says it all.   Line up to get in at 3 PM on a Tuesday aft!! Can't beat it.  True québécois cuisine.

La Banquise serves poutine in almost every way imaginable. My boyfriend and I shared the La Matty (bacon, mushrooms, green peppers and onions) and it was more than enough to put us into a coma except we also ordered a hot chicken sandwich. **PSA for Americans: the hot chicken sandwich is not like an American chicken sandwich. It's not breaded or fried and it is definitely not spicy (hot). It is literally white bread, plain chicken breast, gravy and peas on top.** The poutine was heavy but tasty. I highly recommend getting a version with onions or some other type of veggie in order to help with the heaviness. The chicken sandwich was a surprise but edible as well. Would return again but just for poutine. Ca$h or debit card only.

First time I've ever had poutine and it was amazing. We ordered the classic. They have vegan options, but I didn't try it. Line was crazy when we got there but it goes by fairly quickly and the food is 100% worth the wait anyway. If you're open to ordering to go, the line is significantly shorter. If you are coming from outside of Canada, keep in mind they only take cash and Canadian debit cards. They have an ATM there but I'm not sure if they only take Canadian debit cards.
Diner food québécois style. Fun, no pretense, good gravy, sweet potatoes that make it all worth it. Find an off time so you don't need to wait on line.

Poutine paradise! I can check this off my bucket list.This place was jammed packed! We came here on a Saturday afternoon and waited in line for 30mins.Service was a little slow; some tables seated after us received their food and drinks first while my gf and I patiently wait.Everyone who worked there looked like they were having a good time.

Ideally, poutine is a sloppy mess of soggy fries and big meaty chunks of cheese curds doused in gravy, and ideally it comes from some shack next to a gas station. La Banquise is definitely not a shack. There's a line out the door. The space just before the counter and the host's podium is too small for any frequent eater of poutine. Don't let any of this fool you. The poutine here mimics the best. It might be the best.The fries are half crispy, half saturated. The cheese curds are evenly distributed. The gravy is rich and a little sweet. For the wait, I would recommend just taking it out. This will give the components a chance to steep together in the bag on the way home.I didn't venture out of the standard classique, but I can say that the base of any variety will be good.Worth

This has to be be the worst poutine. The fries were soggy, burnt and old. I don't understand why there is a queue outside to get inside. I ended upWith a bad stomach afterwards. How can you F up making crispy fries.
It's very YUMMY! The smoked meat on poutine is good. Cozy restaurant near La Fontaine Park. Long lines; however, fast turn around. Bring CASH, unless you have a Canadian debit card.

A MUST STOP! We got the smoked meat poutine and ended up devouring the whole box within 5 minutes. It was THAT good! The poutine at La Banquise is legit - everything from the fries to the gravy to the curds to the MEAT were perfection. The curds squeaked in my teeth as I ate them - that, people, is how you know that you're having some good poutine. Goddamn, my own review is making me drool and that photo that I've posted is definitely not helping lol.

It's worth the hype. Important to note that you need a Canadian debit card or cash-- so make sure you're ready before you head on over. Honestly, a lot of folks will have their own as a meal but you could definitely share. Portion is decently large.

Went at 9:45am, no line up and we were the only table. Received great and fast service from the staffs. We shared a regular La Fred Caillou... it's meat meat meat meat. It gets a bit salty towards the end.

We arrived at banquise around 11:45. We haven't wait so much and got a place at terrasse.I ordered 3 viandes Poutine with a traditional coleslaw salad.Though I like the poutine I don't think it was the best one.For me, La Banquise is more likely to be a tourist attraction and a good place for night life food. The poutine is too salty for me. My no.1 poutine still goes Lemaire near Drummondville and Ben de la bedaine of Granby.
Worth the hype! The line moves pretty fast so don't shy away. We shared a large between 4 people and it was more than enough

Highly recommended by several locals and huge lines - see photos to make your decision.  I love poutine and have to admit this wasn't my favorite.  It wasn't bad, but not the best I've ever tasted. Regular portion large enough to share between 2-3 people and certainly a mea for two( no matter how much you consume). It's a Montreal tradition and I'd definitely recommend - skip the line and order take out / come early

Every time I go to Montréal this restaurant has to be the first place I stop.. they have the best poutine in Montreal. The service is great , very polite. The food is fantastic, very large selection of poutine and the price is reasonable

Went here in early august late one night. With cousins. The place was packed even at 12am. We had to wait a couple of minutes to get a table. Once in, we cramped into the tiny table we were given even through we were 7 people and we were probably given the largest table, we had a hard time being comfortable. The food arrived 20 mins in. It was, just like us, cramped in a tiny plate. None of us could eat without potatoes falling off of our plates. Because of the small smace one of us spilled his drink, ofcourse. We couldn't get a server to get us towels for the spilled drink. We had to get all our napkins from our bags so that it doesnt spill on us. The food tasted ok, but I wont say I loved it. The balance of spices was missing and that's really important for me. We got out of there as fast as we could and I will say that I will prefer not going here for poutine again. I have had better poutine with much better sitting arrangement and service.

This was my first experience trying poutine & boy was it worth the wait! Even thought the lines were long it moved pretty fast and the staff was very  courteous. I ordered the Royale which was topped with pork, bacon, and apples. My boyfriend ordered the Reggae which was topped with ground beef, guacamole, and peppers. The Royale was a lot sweeter than I imagined but it perfectly contrasted the salty cheese and fries. The Reggae was loaded with Guacamole! Neither of us could finish a whole regular portion. It's deff possible to split with another person. Be aware that you can't consume alcohol if you sit on the patio.

La Banquise is one of the must-visit places when coming to Montreal. Although I've lived here for a while, I didn't have the chance to go to La Banquise until this week. The queues are usually long but we managed to get a table fast on a Thursday evening. I ordered the reggae poutine and a beer from the house. With no doubt the best poutine I've ever eaten. Thumbs up!
The poutine was so good!!! I feel like any type you order would be good. We got La Elvis and La Shoot-Out. They accept USD. For the place being so busy, we were seated pretty quickly

Was excited to try the authentic poutine. But any U.S. travelers be aware ...The restaurant doesn't accept credit cards ( and they don't tell you until you have to pay- and no signs).They also have a "convenience fee of $15 cad " on your order to compensate if you pay in USD.....Poutine on the other hand was very good. Fries were crispy and toppings added nice flavors
If you're into poutine, this is the place for you. I went in summer and sat out in the patio. The portions are big, i shared a regular sized poutine with a friend.

Definitely a stop to go to if visiting Montreal! Poutine is a must try local favorite ! A very heavy dish but yummy. The lines are long but they move fast sin e the menu is mainly fries and toppings ! We got a regular and split it with my husband and it was just enough ! I could not imagine getting a large size. This is a place I recommend going to for Poutine. All poutine comes with gravy and cheese curds and then you build it from there. They have tons of options on the menu to try!

After hearing so much about it... it was so... mehI've had better poutine in Berkeley at Smoke's. The gravy here (though at least it was vegetarian) was so overly sweet and tasted like it came from a packet. The fries themselves were fine, not quite crispy. Huge portions and not too pricey, at least. The cheese curds were pretty good and squeaky, at least. I would do a little more research and fine better poutine next time though.

Came here at 5:00am after bar hopping and was not disappointed. Being from NJ, fries drenched in gravy and cheese is the only way to end a night . Stop here and have poutine like it's meant to be eaten . Also, cash only so bring some or use the ATM.
Very disappointed.  They haved reduced nearly all cheese and had hardly any sauce.  This is not what i came for.  Too bad i wont be coming back any time soon.

There is always a line for this place! I wanted to try this place before dinner and had to wait until after because I was hoping the line would die down. The staff was super nice and the place has a very hipster vibe. I definitely had high expectations for the food here. I'm not a huge poutine connoisseur (definitely a potato connoisseur though), so I'm not sure if my fries are supposed to be super soggy because of the gravy but I definitely like my fries crispier. Additionally, the cheese curd wasn't soft enough because they were on the colder side. Lastly, the gravy was a little bland and didn't have enough flavor. This made me crave some ketchup and regular fries instead. Overall, I would give the fries a 5/10. However, I am definitely willing to come back and try it again!
Came here with my family of 6. As we wanted to try Pauline. This place did not disappoint!! We ordered different versions of toppings and it was soooo good. My kids absolutely loved it!!

Food: we got regular poutine and Mexican. Veggie gravy what more can you ask for. Servings large is enough for two people but the regular is a good amount also in case you want two different types.  We took it to go and so the fries got a little soggy but they were crispy when we first got them. So if you can eat there. Make sure you order water the salt and gravy and cheese makes you thirsty. Regular poutine is gravy and curds. Mexican has black olives, hot peppers and tomatoes. Location: they are located near a park so if you want to eat outside. Inside plenty of seating. Washrooms are clean. Price: decent considering you get so much. Will definitely come back!!

La Banquise is good! Whenever I have someone visiting me in Montreal I always bring them here due to the large selection of poutines (and they even have a vegan one). As someone who lives in Montreal however, this is not a restaurant I come to often. There's almost always a huge line, even in the winter, and the service is very lacklustre. The waitress and waiters definitely want to get you in and out in a swift manner, and if I am taking too long finishing up eating my food and leaving I feel very rushed and uncomfortable. Sometimes you just want to sit and enjoy your food you know? As for the poutine, I always get the same thing, "La Festival." It's a poutine with Swiss cheese, ground beef, hot peppers, and onion rings. I LOVE what I get, however this visit the onion rings were VERY small, compared to the amount I usually get, and I felt like I didn't get my money's worth. Otherwise it was really delicious. I would definitely recommend this place to any tourist visiting in Montreal. It's a cute restaurant and it definitely has personality. I can attest that there is no poutinerie quite like La Banquise so definitely give it a shot!

Came here on a Friday night around 10pm.Line was long but it moves fast. The line starts as one but once inside it divided into take-out and sit in.Ambience: Vibrant and colorful.Service: Straight to the pointFood: I got the one with mushrooms, green peppers and bacon. The bf had the one with ground beef, tomatoes, and Swiss cheese. Both quite good. I feel like tomatoes makes it taste better so I suggest you add that to your dish.I highly suggest if in the mood for poutine, especially after a night of drinking.

La Banquise is known for their poutine. Dan and I walked there and walked right past it. We sat outside in the back patio area. The waiter took a while to take our order and once he did we ordered a small poutine to share. They had many variations and we chose the one with guac, tomatoes. It felt like it took FOREVER (said like the Sandlot) to receive one small order of poutine, which I thought was ridiculous. I ventured off to the bathroom and that stunk like sewage. Yuck!! Tried to hold my breathe Once we received the food we started nibbling away. It was ok not great. Sort of disappointing for the long wait and adventure to find the place. The cheese curds didn't taste as fresh, gravy ok, fries alright. Next time in Montreal, we're going to venture out to other poutine places

Has been here a handful of times over the last 10 years!Love the variations they have from the steak to mexican to vegetarian options!Their fries are crispy while the gravy is perfectly seasoned. The pepper sauce is a must add... but warning its a bit addictive!Long line ups at times but it moves quick with ample seatings!Try to go during off times as they are opened 24 hrs!

A local recommended this place to me for authentic poutine. It did not disappoint. We were lucky enough to come when there was no line (Wednesday at 11:30am), which apparently is unusual. Place was busy, but we were seated immediately. Waitstaff is attentive and bilingual (French and English). I ordered regular-sized La Classique. It was a very generous helping. It was delicious. I'd recommend if you like lots of potatoes and gravy and cheese curds. There were other variations on the menu, but I wanted to try the original first. Heads up that this place only takes Canadian cash or Canadian debit cards. There is an ATM at the entrance where you can get cash. Also this place is open 24/7.

Great place. Believe or not, they served the best/one of the best hotdogs I ever had. The poutine was good - however not entirely crazy about. I give this place a good review for the authenticity of real poutine. For my taste, the cheese curds were too big and wish they has more of then with a smaller size. The gravy was good and wish the fries were better covered with it.I think my biggest qualm is the quality of the fries. Eating them by theirselves heavy, a little dry, and on the toastier side. If they were a bit lighter in batter and could easily eat fry after fry by itself, I would gladly give it a 5.
Location is good, value for money isn't, service is good, cuisine is definitely overrated because the poutine was missing both, cheese and gravy, and ambiance is good.

[LOCATION] - 4/5This place is located on Rue Rachel E and Avenue du Parc-La Fontaine. There was an insane line
for the dine-in side of the restaurant, so we opted for takeout instead.[SERVICE] - 5/5Staff on the takeout side were very quick and efficient. They gave us a buzzer to indicate when our
food is ready. We wandered out of the restaurant for a few minutes, and our buzzer already
indicated our food was ready![DÉCOR] - 5/5Small, intimate, and old Montreal vibes. The mismatching tables and chairs gave the place quite a
unique personality.[QUALITY] - 4/5Generous portions with high-quality ingredients in every poutine![ORDER] - 4/5Le Classique - $11.75: fries had a hint of sweetness to them, which gave them a unique flavour
to balance the savoury gravy. Cheese curds had the perfect consistency and melted perfectly
on top of the fries and gravy.[OVERALL] - 4/5Personally, I like my fries just a little crunchier because the fries here were a little soggy. But
overall, I think the gravy was not overly salty, and cheese curds mixed together to create a
close-to-perfect concoction. I would definitely recommend La Banquise for the classic Canadian
poutine!

Best Poutine in Montreal. Got to have some poutine when I visit Canada. Restaurant always so packed, but they are quick and and friendly where you don't have to wait so long. We ordered the classic and smoked meat mushrooms and sour cream. Really...... good. Must check out this restaurant when you're in town.

Super cool place!La Banquise came highly recommended from friends and it certainally did not disappoint! We showed up midday on a rainy Saturday and the lines was still out the door! We elected to carry out but it looked like the line moves fast.The poutine was excellent! They had a lot of really interesting options but we went with the t-Rex. The quality was great, poutine doesn't seem like something that can be a really high quality in nature but the flavors of the smoked meats was very good!We would definately come back to dine in!

As most of the reviews indicate, this place for sure offers one of the best poutines in the Montreal city! Prepare yourself to see a veryyy long line up but I would say do not let it scare you away as it moves fairly fast and the poutines are totally worth waiting! We went there quite late on Saturday night, around 11 pm, but still, there was a long line. However, it did not take long that we were seated and taken orders. The service was great; friendly, fast, and very accommodating. The menu offers a good variety of poutines, including both vegetarian and meatarian. The indoor is a bit dense and noisy with chairs and tables arranged back to back. Overall, if you consider yourself a poutine fan, give this place a try! You will not regret!

Poutine and good beer. What a great combination!On this rainy day, we stopped by La Banquise for Montreal's best poutine. Well, I mostly convinced my friends to go there, so I can taste all of their beer. LolOkay, so if you plan to drink, you can only sit inside. The law--what kinda law that needs another permit to allow ppl to drink outside of a building--won't allow you to enjoy nice food and beer on the patio with an awesome weather. Well, I guess we're stuck inside. We ordered 2 regular orders of La Festival and La Matty. La Festival is a must try since it comes with pickled peppers. La Matty was good as well. This place only takes cash. Why????

This place was rated one of the best places in Montreal to enjoy a poutine so we had to go. Did not disappoint. We tried the smoked meat poutine and also the one with ground beef, delicious! That being said, not the best poutine or even the top 10 that I've had in my life. But I would call myself a poutine connoisseur. They are big meals, could easily be shared between two people. The atmosphere in here was really lively and our server was attentive. We were told if we planned to order beer that we couldn't get a table on the patio. Strange but I guess there's some licensing rule they were following.

In my humble opinion, La Banquise makes the Best Poutine in Montreal!!  They make all kinds of variations of this Canadian delicacy.  It can be confusing deciding which one to order.  So what is poutine?  It is a dish consisting of French fries and cheese curds topped with a brown gravy.  I ordered a large La Sud-Ouest Poutine rather than going with their La Classique.  La Sud-Ouest's ingredients include, bacon, red onions, guacamole, onion rings, and chipotle sauce.  Yeah, nothing traditional about it at all.  Boy, did it taste incredible!!  I was polite and shared it with the family.  Everyone gave it the thumbs up.Each family member ordered something other than Poutine from the menu.  We then shared my order plus one other order of Poutine. Honestly, though, I think you should only order Poutine when you visit La Banquise.  I look forward to trying more of their Poutine menu in the not too distant future.Do yourself a favor and drop in to La Banquise.  You can visit any time of the day because they are open 24 hours!   They aren't a fancy diner, but their Poutine sure is scrumptious!!

This was my first time having poutine in Canada (I've always had poutine in the states).  My friend and I ordered La Calliou, a corn dog and jalapeno poppers. The poutine came out piping hot. The potatoes were crispy and smothered with delicious gravy, ground beef, smoked meat and sausage.  The cheese curds started to melt a bit as well.  The jalapeno poppers actually had a nice kick to them.  And the corn dog was delicious as well.The server was very nice.  We got to sit outside and it was nicely decorated.  We beat the dinner rush and came around 5pm on a weekday.  By the time we were done, there was a long line!

So, I guess I don't get all the hype. THAT SAID, I don't really like gravy, and I don't eat dairy, so I came here just to try the fries. I guess you could say I'm a bit of a fry purist; the fry should be able to stand on its own. These didn't. They were soggy and just nothing impressive. I did get a side of grilled onions, which really enhanced the fries, so I can see how if you're into piling cheese, gravy meat and all kinds of stuff on your potatoes this place would be a go-to. The space was cute and creative, and the staff was very friendly. And they do have 20+ varieties of poutine waiting for you. It's worth a try. You be the judge

This is such a fun, hipster poutine joint. A colorful board outlining the poutine variations greets you at the door. That's if a long line extending outside doesn't greet you first. Luckily, we arrived right before the afternoon rush and made it just in time to beat the line leading outside the door on a frigid Sunday afternoon. La Banquise is just that good. I came for poutine, but easily got seduced by the veggie burger on the menu. Not to fear, La Banquise provides a burger and poutine option. How clever. You can do basic fries, a classic poutine (gravy and cheese curds), or dress it up to a poutine special for a few more bucks. Of course I went all the way and ordered the veggie burger with La Taquise--a Mexican spin on poutine with guacamole and sour cream. The veggie burger is your standard soy patty and sesame bun, topped with coleslaw. It's quite the filler. The poutine side is a hefty portion and food overload. I couldn't even finish, but it was surely delicious. Add a local beer and you're all set to waddle out in poutine bliss.
Came to Montreal for a weekend and heard to try this place. I got the poutine with fried pickles and it was amazing. If I came to Montreal again I would definitely come back!
The wait is long but always worth it! Food is delicious and at a fair price. If you cant wait, order a takeout

Super amazing poutine! A regular portion is more than enough for one person! I first came here for an Airbnb experience on the terrace. Really enjoyed the poutine and the experience, which was on the Joual sociolect, basically Québécois slang! Great experience overall. We came back on our second trip to MTL by ourselves and although we had to wait in a long line, it moved fast and we enjoyed a lovely conversation with a Québécois mom and her daughter who shared their top recommendations for the poutine. I have had both the reggae poutine and la taquise. Both feature guac which is amazing on poutine but la taquise is vegetarians and the reggae has meat. We learned on our first trip that you can't order alcohol on the terrace so made sure to specify that we wanted a table where we could get beers the second time we came. My only minor complaint was that although the bathroom was super clean there was no soap in the soap dispenser! Go here, eat poutine, flourish!

You cannot go to Montreal and not go to La Banquise. We didn't have to wait long for a table for lunch on a Saunday, but I hear it is super busy at night. The regular size is good for one person, and the large is supposed to be for two. I saw the size of the large, and it is HUGE. Five of us shared four poutines and it was definitely enough for all of us! I love their toppings and the variety of poutines you get. Definitely a must try!

What started off as a hot dog and fries joint in the late 60s, La Banquise has become one of the city's preeminent poutineries. They've created an entire spectrum of poutine that goes beyond just gravy, cheese curds, and fries; a variety of which would appease all sorts of palates. The poutine portion of their menu is incredible. There are all sorts of combinations, even specialized ones like an all vegan one (Veganomaniac). I really wish I was able to try them all but the standouts for me were the:The T-Rex - chopped steak, pepperoni, bacon, sausage, hot dog.The Reggae - chopped steak, guacamole, diced tomatoes, hot peppersBougalou - pulled pork, creamy cabbage salad, sour creamThe Shoot Out - smoked meats, spicy sausage, pepperoni, baconThe Duleton - chopped steak and onionsI also highly recommend coming with a large group. Fortunately I was able to roll with a deep crew of dining companions and we were able to order all sorts of food for everyone. There may be a wait depending on the time of arrival, but thank goodness this spot is open 24 hours a day.At one point they were a divey spot, but after a change in ownership a couple of decades back, followed by a huge renovation, this has become an eatery that plenty to offer. There is now burgers, sandwiches, soups, salads, and a separate brunch menu. A big plus for drinkers: they also have a ton of craft brews.Service is also good for what it is. They deal with a lot of knuckleheads on the weekend and minus the ambiance of young folks, it's also not a bad idea to come in and order takeout. Drunk or sober, be sure to bring your appetite.

Fries are my kryptonite.  I like 'em crispy or soft, criss-cut or curly.  But fries as a meal?  I'm listening...During my seven day stay in Montreal, I had poutine three times.  Because we showed up on a busy Friday night, we decided to go to Poutineville for one of those times.  Expect to see a line out the door, but you may get lucky.  On a Thursday night after we got out of the Kings/Habs game, we were able to get sat right away.  I liked La Banquise a little more than I liked Poutineville.  La Banquise's fries are smaller.  Their vegan gravy was thicker and did not make the fries soggy like the ones I had at Poutineville.  The curds were a lot squeakier at Poutineville, however.  The cheese at La Banquise didn't have that squeak factor, but it may have been because they were slightly more melted.  They actually reminded me more of mozzarella than curds.  The portions were comparable.  The plate seems smaller at La Banquise, but they give you a generous mounded serving.  Regular is plenty for one person.  La Banquise has some creative signature dishes and I only had the classic version at Poutineville.  Poutineville has several different gravies and all of them are vegetarian, except for the meat sauce.They serve Bec sodas, a local company that uses all natural ingredients and sweetens their drinks with maple syrup.  I tried the cola and cranberry sodas.  They were extremely carbonated and the sodas would bubble up through the straw.  It added to the whimsy of drinking soda from a glass bottle.  I'm not a big soda drinker, but I am a sucker for anything maple.  I enjoyed the Bec cola.  The cranberry had kind of an unpleasant aftertaste.Service was on point.  The servers were sweethearts on both visits.  Even though they were busy, we never felt rushed.  Water was refilled often.No credit cards accepted.  Cash or Canadian debit cards only.  ATM located at the entrance.  Expect to pre-pay for your meal after 9PM.  Too many drunken dine and dashers, I imagine.

Not a big fan. Fries where too dark. Some were even burnt.the gravy on the poutine had no flavor and curds were not melted enough. My wife had their pork sandwich. Bun was almost burnt on top and bun was also soggy from way too much sauce on the pork. Her fries were also almost burnt. The table sitting next tp us had fries and they were perfectly cooked. So this place seems a little inconsistent. They also seem to rush you.

One of my favourite places to get Poutine! I always get La taquise with hot peppers. So good! Guacamole, sour cream and tomatoes!  My one problem with this place is the plates they use for the small is too small, because they put huge portions on them. Total plus, unless you like mixing everything like I do. I asked both waiters for the Poutine in a bigger bowl/plate First guy said he'd just give me an under plate, when I asked specifically for a certain bowl (the one the large comes in) and then when it didn't come with an under plate I asked the girl who dropped it off for the bowl I wanted and she brought me a smaller plate. I finally just said forget it, because all I wanted was not to make a mess on the table and to be able to mix my Poutine how I wanted. It wasn't busy, why couldn't they just bring me the bowl I wanted instead of offering other plates. I could see it in sight, however it would of been rude to get it myself. HahaOur waiter jean-Ralph Switched to English when I spoke English to him and he was very friendly and attentive. I love this place and recommend it to every out of towner I meet! This may sound like a diva move but I just wanted a bigger bowl!! lol

Poutine was delicious!! Stuck with the classic since it was our first trip there but the other poutines looked equally good from what I saw of the people sitting around us. Staff was extremely friendly and attentive!

If you're looking to try poutine, La Banquise is a great place to do it. Their poutine menu has around 20 different options, some vegetarian and some meat-based. My friend and I had La Rachel (peppers, mushrooms and onions) and La Taquise (guacamole, sour cream and tomato) and both were great. It was definitely a lot of food, so come hungry enough to finish your entree since poutine doesn't make for good leftovers. While I loved the outdoor seating, I thought it was strange that their liquor license does not allow them to serve alcohol on the patio, only indoors. It would definitely be in their interest to get this corrected.

Everything I could hope for and more.  Seriously amazing and fast. There was a line but don't be fooled it moves fast. They will call for different party size and you can skip the line. The la scooby was a nice treat. Large was enough for me and the wife

Visited montreal and heard this was the spot to try poutine, all over it was alright. This is definitely not something you would want to eat weekly if not once in awhile (once every few months). Came and saw that the line was pretty line, opted to do take out and eat it at a near by park. The cashier tried to short change me 5 bucks,  not sure if it was an honest mistake or not but he nicely gave me the correct change. They do not accept credit cards, but do accept debt cards, also they have an ATM machine inside if you need cash.

I came here with my husband while in town on our "mini-moon".  We took a food tour through Airbnb and this was one of the stops.  While I'm not the biggest fan of poutine, this was the best poutine I've had.  Being from Chicago, I'm used to "Wisconsin" poutine which is really just fried cheese curds on fries with gravy so I was pleasantly surprised to see non-fried cheese curds and plenty of topping options.  Definitely worth trying if you're in Montreal!

O.M.G. This place is literally a place i think about going to like almost everyday. Okay not literally. But I would say the poutine I had here was literally the best I've ever had. The French fries were cooked to perfection, and they weren't too big or too small. The gravy was very tasty. The cheese curds were amazing. I also got ground beef, hot peppers, some other cheese lol and onion rings, which were also cooked to perfection. It was so delicious. When I'm back in Montreal, which I will be, I will be stopping here no matter what! And I can't wait! The prices are reasonable. Staff was great. And the outside seating was great. If your in Montreal, this is a must stop.

One of the best Poutines in town, get the T-Rex or something with Guacamole. Also their burgers are good and they have a good collection of Craft beer.I always take my guests from out of town here or to Dirty dogs. My personal favourite is LA Banquise though!

My first time in Montreal and everyone said I had to try poutine and I had to go to La Banquise to try it. We walked over from our Airbnb and saw the line from down the block. As much as a long line can be discouraging, I was happy because I took it to mean the food would be good. We waited about 30-45 minutes before we were seated. The staff was friendly and accommodating since my friend and I had never been there before so we took a while studying the menu. There were a few poutine options but we stuck with La Classique (regular poutine), which didn't take long to come out. My first time trying poutine...it was great and worth the wait!

I just love coming in at 4 in the morning for some poutine. Yep, flew in around midnight, hung out in the hotel for a bit and the very first thing I did was to get some poutine here.Couple of things though...because this is Montreal...no alcohol after 3am which is bs, and I guess we pay ahead of time. Seemed appropriate, because when I was there, there was a scuffle and the police had to show up. Oh well, whatever.Again, cash only or debit. These guys know how to make some good poutine. It's a tie between these guys and Poutineville. That's why I always go to both at least once every time I go to Montreal.

We kept hearing about this place. Heard it was one of the top 5 places to get fries in the world. So naturally we came. Look this is strictly preference for me but I wished I just ordered the classic Poutine and been on my merry way. But the waitress talked me into getting Poutine covered in 10lbs of something because she made the argument I had Poutine before so try something new and different here. Made sense.Thing is, Poutine for me, doesn't need 10 pounds of stuff on it. It's perfect the way it is. I can't remember the name of what I ordered but it had all the makings of Poutine (cheese and gravy) but it came with a mountain of ground beef, sliced hot dogs, and slivered beef salami. Now look it was still good. But I found myself picking around everything just to get to the gravy cheese and potatoes, which were amazing lollll. So if this is your first time here, I recommend doing the classic and then moseying your way around the menu eventually.

It's worth the hype. Do you want some real poutine? Go to La Banquise and you will find poutine of any and almost every variety that you could ever ask for. It's a local, casual spot that is filled with tourists and natives alike. Here's the breakdown:1. There's a line. Get used to it. There is a heater outside but stay bundled if you're visiting in the winter.2. This is the Canadian version of no-frills. What you see is what you get.3. You can find poutine for almost all of your needs ever.4. Service is minimal. It's a combination of French manners, the no-frills, and volume. Don't walk in with high expectations.5. You're in and you're out. This isn't really a spot to chill for a while. It's completely worth a visit here.
